meanings.definition: To completely surround or cover something
meanings.sent1: The waves will engulf the sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The fire quickly engulfed the entire forest.
meanings.sent3: The hungry puppy tried to engulf its oversized bone.
meanings.sent4: The darkness seemed to engulf the room, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent5: The fog began to engulf the city, shrouding it in a mysterious veil.

meanings.sent1: The feeling of sadness can sometimes engulf a person.
meanings.sent2: The loud music engulfed the entire room, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies seemed to engulf the entire house.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was so great that it seemed to engulf everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night seemed to engulf everything, creating a sense of isolation.
